headline.print_headline: NATO, Tested by Russia in Syria,  Raises Its Guard and Its Tone
headline.main: NATO, Tested by Russia in Syria, Raises Its Guard and Its Tone

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and JAMES KANTER

snippet: Western military officials said they were deploying some logistics personnel in Central and Eastern Europe, raising tensions with Moscow.
abstract: North Atlantic Treaty Organization, alarmed by speed and scope of Russia's intervention in Syria, is moving to bolster NATO flanks in Middle East and Europe, faced with largest military challenge since Cold War's end; Western officials, leery of exacerbating situation, have cautiously made small steps, like increasing military exercises, while increasing heat of rhetoric against Russia.
lead_paragraph: Western military officials said they were deploying some logistics personnel in Central and Eastern Europe, raising tensions with Moscow.
